snippet.title: Tom Sietsema: At Carolina Kitchen, southern-fried sweetness governs cooking, greeting
snippet.description: At Carolina Kitchen on Rhode Island Row, sugar glazes the attitude, and the cooking.

snippet.title: Bibimbap: A favorite way to use leftovers
snippet.description: The Korean dish is a healthful way to clean out the fridge and please kids.

snippet.title: At Flight Wine Bar, more than 80 wines
snippet.description: Chances are good that among the 80-plus wines, you'll get to try something you don't see every day.

snippet.title: Hard-boiled eggs can elevate a dish without overpowering it
snippet.description: Keep your runny yolks. I'd rather chop firm eggs and sprinkle them on salads or slice them for sandwiches.

snippet.title: If you're going to follow a paleo diet, you ought to be eating bugs
snippet.description: Two books offer insight — and recipes — on the value of entomophagy.

snippet.title: Passover, with a strictly biblical flavor
snippet.description: In a quest to bring something new to the Seder table, the author finds liberating traditions.

snippet.title: Red Beans and Cauliflower Rice
snippet.description: This twist on the traditional Creole dish of red beans and rice takes out the smoky meats and uses "rice" made from cauliflower, a boon to those following a low-carb diet -- or anyone looking for a different way to get their veggie fix. The beauty of using home-cooked beans is the bean-cooking liquid, which adds flavor and creaminess here. Of course, you can serve the beans over real rice instead.

snippet.title: Achievement gaps between Montgomery's high-poverty, low-poverty high schools grow
snippet.description: County report focuses on achievement gaps by school and divide by race, ethnicity and income.

snippet.title: Benihana's Be the Chef program is a sizzling good time
snippet.description: What's the secret of the 50-year-old restaurant's success? We're not sure, but it might include self-service.

snippet.title: In red beans and 'rice,' there's an extra vegetable to play with
snippet.description: The Weeknight Vegetarian adds a few twists to the traditional New Orleans dish.
